page.title: 14TRADE GARDEN CENTRE TUNSTALL
page.content: Before the garden centre opened seven years ago,the buildings were owned by the Kent Farming Institute and were used for storing compost.When it first opened the centre covered one and a half acres, but now the garden centre covers six acres.Plants and shrubs are sold most to the public, which are brought in from several suppliers.There are fifteen full time staff.The most difficult plants to grow are pot plants because they need constant attention. The centre opens at 9.00am and closes at 5.30pm,seven days a week.In the summer around 1000 people visit the garden centre on Sundays. The garden centre is not a proper nursery where plans are grown from seed. They only merchandise plants and shrubs to the customers, which makes some of the plants poor quality. Tropical fish and goldfish are also sold.
